trans-unit.source: Represents a condition that must be taken into account when assessing the validity of a SAML assertion.

<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions and a set of conditions that must be taken into account when assessing the validity of the SAML assertion.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition> class represents a single condition.
An example of a condition is whether the SAML assertion must not be cached, which is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition> class.
The SAML specification defines two conditions and it allows for the set of conditions to be extended.
The two conditions defined by the SAML specification are <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition>.
To define a new condition, derive a class from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition"></xref> class.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
`true` if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
When overridden in a derived class, causes this instance to be read-only.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition.MakeReadOnly%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
When overridden in a derived class, reads the condition from the specified XML reader.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the condition.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML authorization statement that is defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that reads the `KeyInfo` clause of the digital signature.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
When overridden in a derived class, writes the condition into the specified XML serializer.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> to write the condition.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing `KeyInfo` clauses.
